jobs.title: Product Owner - Green Chef
jobs.description:
***Come see what’s cookin’ at Green Chef! ***

At Green Chef, we want to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch. We have offices all over the world and we deliver delicious meals to millions of people. 

We are the industry leader in meal-kit subscription services and we’re growing all the time. We have distinct meal-kit services that cater to everyone with the most menu variety in the market, which allows us to reach an incredibly wide population of people. 

The Green Chef  team is diverse, high-performing, and international, and our work environment is an inspiring space where you can thrive as a result. 

**Job Description: **

As a Product Owner, you’ll report to the Sr. Product Manager, take ownership of growth features and be expected to add value to our end customers that supports faster growth and market expansion. You will be the customer voice of the scrum team and work closely with design and engineering to translate ideas into user stories and detailed acceptance criteria. To succeed in this role, you should be able to identify opportunities using data, test your hypotheses, and report on features’ impact to KPIs.  An ability to focus on the highest value initiatives, identify solutions, and work with speed and agility in an egoless manner are core skill sets to this position. 

#### **You will ...**

- Develop, test, and iterate on growth and retention features to add value to our customers and improve acquisition and retention KPIs
- Translate qualitative and quantitative customer data into insights to build business cases and inform prioritization of features by ROI
- Conduct teardowns of key features of our competitors in the meal kit delivery service  and leading subscription model businesses
- Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand pain points and needs, gather requirements, and identify solutions 
- Project manage initiatives with cross-functional teams to improve the Green Chef customer experience in the digital product
- Work with our Boulder-based tech team to translate the business needs into tech solutions and follow progress of work to address issues during sprints

#### **You are...**

- Able to influence key stakeholders, work cross-functionally and autonomously
- Goal-oriented with the ability to break complex, unstructured problems down into components of impact and derive quantifiable action items
- Proactive with good communication skills to clearly articulate and share your work
- Excited to work in a fast-paced, demanding and analytical environment
- Passionate about the customer experience
- A team player; you thrive working closely with our local team as well  as the large international and geographically dispersed teams
- You have a strong business mind-set and are at your best working with e-commerce KPIs
- You feel comfortable being the point of contact for engineering, design, customer support, and senior and global stakeholders

#### **At a minimum, you have...**

- BA/BS in business or STEM-related field (e.g. mathematics, engineering, computer science, economics, statistics, etc.)
- 2-3 years of product experience with a bonus if that experience is  in e-Commerce or a subscription-based companies
- Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills to support data-driven product development  with a baseline knowledge of SQL and data visualization
- Familiarity with Agile methodology, Scrum and Kanban processes
- Understanding of AB testing
- Track record of creative problem solving and the desire to create/build new products
- You have an innate ability to put yourself in the customer's shoes and develop products with their needs in mind
- Experience working with UI/UX  to leverage customer feedback from interviews, surveys, testing and other discovery methods to distill  the results into action items
- Prior experience in conversion rate optimization preferred
- Experience working with cross-functional teams and influencing the organization 
- Have coordinated projects across business units or project management experience
- Experience individually driving projects,  managing multiple projects and balancing priorities
- A pragmatic, hands-on mentality to drive towards impact

  **You’ll get**

- Competitive Salary & 401k company match that vests immediately upon participation
- Generous parental leave of 16 weeks & PTO policy
- $0 monthly premium and other flexible health plans effective first day of employment
- 75% discount on your subscription to HelloFresh (as well as other product initiatives)
- Snacks and catered lunches
- Company sponsored outings & Employee Resource Groups
- Collaborative, dynamic work environment within a fast-paced, mission-driven company

jobs.title: Production Associate
jobs.description:
#### **About HelloFresh:**

At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat. Over the past 7 years we've seen this mission spread around the world and beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are the leading global company in the expanding online recipe kit delivery market. So, how did we do it? Our weekly recipe boxes full of exciting recipes and lovingly sourced, fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of encouraged, energized home cooks that expands across the globe. We are one of the fastest growing meal kit businesses and are active and growing in 10 different countries across 3 continents. If you would like to join an energetic and highly motivated team and work in a dynamic, high-energy, high-growth field where you can really have an impact and make a difference every single day then join us and become part of developing a global fresh food champion.

#### About the Role:

- Kit and pack products as designated by Production Supervisor or Manager
- Ensure quality of product meets Company Standards
- Ensure accuracy when weighing/portioning products
- Ensure accuracy and efficiency at designated ship out stations 
- Assist in additional duties as requested by Production Management
- Permanent- Full time Role

####  Requirements

- The job requires periods of heavy lifting and standing for most of the day 
- Must be willing and able to work in a refrigerated environment (0° to 10°)
- A passion for great food and a natural curiosity to learn more
- Ability to read and take direction in English· 

#### Benefits

**Why join the HelloFresh team?**

At HelloFresh, we’re building the leading online food brand in Canada. If you’re looking to get involved in the early stages of a fast-growing company, then this role is for you!

**Perks include:**

- Flexible work hours
- Large opportunity for increased responsibility and growth in the company
- Opportunity to work with a highly engaged team
- A company culture that promotes out of the box thinking
- Competitive compensation plan

jobs.title: Production Manager (Day Shift)
jobs.description:
**Production Manager**

As Production Manager, you will an integral part of how HelloFresh revolutionizes the food industry and the way people eat! In this role, you will deliver strategic operational leadership across all aspects of production and will cultivate a culture that is second to none. You will be hands-on and immerse yourself in the trenches to optimize productivity, promote growth, spark innovation, and incite change from within. We're searching for a visionary leader who is excited to build something awesome and share it with the world!

The schedule for this role will be Tuesday-Saturday 6am-4pm.

***You will…***

·       Drive continuous development to production, quality, cost, and delivery initiatives while building and maintaining relationships with hourly associates, managers, carrier partners, vendors, and various departments within HelloFresh

·       Oversee the day-to-day production operations, ensuring on-time and accurate delivery of customer orders

·       Effectively engage, coach, motivate and lead the Production team for career progression and development

·       Monitor communication between multiple production lines to eliminate downtime

·       Establish procedures, metrics and processes to drive productivity and optimization

·       Analyze and identify areas of improvement in cost savings, production, and lead times

·       Develop and administer operational procedures for outgoing shipments, handling and disposition of products, and keeping the highest standards of quality

·       Create, learn, and assist on strategic planning and forecasting to improve existing production issues

·       Establish new procedures, metrics, and processes alongside the COO and Director of Operations

·       Develop and administer operational procedures for executing activities for outgoing shipments, handling and disposition of products, and keeping the highest standards of Quality

·       Create a positive team dynamic that encourages all employees to provide feedback and drive change within the facility, adapt to the ever-changing business, and stay focused on the customer experience

***You are...***

·       Bold: you are a true entrepreneurial spirit and not afraid to take calculated risks to disrupt the status quo; you're a visionary leader that listens to your team and values their ideas

·       Analytical: data is your friend; you're able to translate numbers into action and pave the way for efficiency

·       Strategic: you recognize and resolve situations that are ambiguous or challenging, focus effort on meeting or exceeding goals, and pave the way for efficiency

·       Problem-solver: you have a knack for production planning and are a critical thinker who uses logic to identify alternatives and present solutions to complex problems while thinking in terms of contingency plans

·       Customer-focused: slightly obsessive-compulsive when it comes to customer experience and strive to deliver a product that is second to none

***You have...***

·       Bachelor’s degree preferred, diploma or GED required

·       5+ years of operational leadership in food manufacturing/production plant

·       Prior experience in direct to consumer fulfillment / eCommerce operations

·       Understanding of food safety regulations/compliance (SQF, HACCP, AIB, BRC)

·       Proven success managing teams of 100+ employees in a hyper-growth organization - our culture is a critical part of our success, and you need to help drive it

·       Effective project management skills, well-versed in Lean Manufacturing/Continuous Improvement (Six Sigma, APICS, Kaizen certification a plus)

·       Efficient Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Power Point) and Google app (Gmail, drive, sheets, etc.) capabilities

**You'll get...**

 

- Competitive Salary & 401k company match that vests immediately upon participation
- Generous parental leave of 16 weeks & PTO policy, as well as paid holidays off
- $0 monthly premium and other flexible health plans
- Amazing discounts, including up to 75% off HelloFresh subscription
- Emergency child and adult care services
- Snacks & monthly catered lunches
- Collaborative, dynamic work environment within a fast-paced, mission-driven company

 

*It is the policy of HelloFresh not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.*

 

Our team is diverse, high-performing and international, helping us to create a truly inspiring work environment in which you will thrive!

jobs.title: Production Supervisor
jobs.description:
***Come see what’s cookin’ at HelloFresh!***

At HelloFresh, we want to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch. We have offices all over the world and we deliver delicious meals to millions of people.  

We are the industry leader in meal-kit subscription services and we’re growing all the time. We have distinct meal-kit services that cater to everyone with the most menu variety in the market, which allows us to reach an incredibly wide population of people.

The HelloFresh team is diverse, high-performing, and international, and our work environment is an inspiring space where you can thrive as a result.

**Job Description:**

**You will ...**

- Respectfully communicate with all employees and leads.
- Provide coaching and development to shift hourly associates. 
- Provide all employees with necessary tools, proper training and corrective direction.
- Report information and update managers throughout every shift with knowledge of that day’s production.
- Resolve employee issues through appropriate problem resolution. 
- Check and respond to emails in a timely manner.
- Balance quality, productivity, cost, safety and morale to achieve positive results in all areas. 
- Work to continuously improve processes. 
- Manage departmental performance measures, including visual controls and provides regular progress reports to Associate Production Manager/Manager during the shift.
- Submit paperwork at the end of the shift.
- Conduct daily shift meetings and safety meetings with employees.
- Conduct interviews for nonexempt shifts within the department.
- Perform accident investigations.  
- Manage department priorities as situations arise.
- Track absenteeism and timekeeping daily. 
- Perform accident investigations and notify management as appropriate

  **You are...**

- A leader: able to train and develop a large group of employees and manage multiple production lines
- A problem solver      
- Results driven 
- Able speak to employees with tact and diplomacy     
- Able to multitask: tracking/monitoring production and maintaining productivity
- Computer literate to input information into the computer
- Able to take direction and relay information to employees
- Comfortable with being exposed to cool and/or cold environment (10º - 40º)

**At a minimum, you have...**

- Required: High School Diploma or GED or related work experience 
- Preferred: At least 1-3 years of supervisory experience in a production environment 

**You’ll get…**

- Competitive Salary &  401K company match that vests immediately upon participation
- Generous parental leave of 16 weeks & PTO policy
- $0 monthly premium and other flexible health plans effective first day of employment
- 75% discount on your subscription to HelloFresh (as well as other product initiatives)
- Snacks, coffee & catered meals   
- Company sponsored outings & Employee Resource Groups
- Collaborative, dynamic work environment within a fast-paced, mission-driven company

 

It is the policy of HelloFresh not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.

**Food Production Supervisor** **(Contract Position)**

**Duration: Up to 6 Months**

The Food Production Supervisor is responsible for allocating duties and supervising team leads and team members to ensure high quality products are produced while remaining compliant with all Green Chef policies and procedures.

**Essential Functions:**

- Allocate duties and monitor activity and workflow to ensure that all warehouse production deadlines are met
- Confer with Warehouse Managers and fellow supervisory team throughout distribution center to ensure coordination of all warehouse activities
- Coordinate with production team to ensure all organizational systems are functioning efficiently
- Maintain timely updates of productivity throughout shift, promptly communicating any deviations from plan
- Monitor proper use and safe handling of food production equipment
- Monitor weekly scheduling of team leads and team members
- Ensure compliance with food safety guidelines
- Ensure that all production processes are properly executed
- Ensure all items produced comply with stringent quality guidelines
- Monitor compliance of GMPs, promptly addressing violations
- Regular and timely completion of Team Lead Evaluation Checklists
- Communicate all staffing concerns with Warehouse Food Production Manager
- Promptly communicate all safety related issues and concerns
- All other functions as determined by management

**Supervisory Responsibilities** :

- Supervise and effectively lead warehouse food production team leads and team members

**Required Experience/Education:**

- High School Diploma or equivalent
- Bachelor’s Degree preferred
- 2-5 years supervising in a food distribution or food production facility
- Knowledge of operating a USDA or FDA food facility preferred
- HACCP training preferred

**Physical Demands:**

- Ability to lift 50 pounds regularly
- Ability to stand for prolonged periods of time
- Regular stooping, squatting, bending, twisting, and walking

**Working Conditions** :

- Temperature controlled warehouse environment
- Must be able to withstand temperatures ranging from -20 degrees Fahrenheit to ambient room temperature

It is the policy of Green Chef not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.

jobs.title: Production Supervisor (Swing Shift)
jobs.description:
***Come see what’s cookin’ at HelloFresh!***

At HelloFresh, we want to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch. We have offices all over the world and we deliver delicious meals to millions of people.  

We are the industry leader in meal-kit subscription services and we’re growing all the time. We have distinct meal-kit services that cater to everyone with the most menu variety in the market, which allows us to reach an incredibly wide population of people.

The HelloFresh team is diverse, high-performing, and international, and our work environment is an inspiring space where you can thrive as a result.

**Job Description:**

**You will ...**

- Respectfully communicate with all employees and leads.
- Provide coaching and development to shift hourly associates. 
- Provide all employees with necessary tools, proper training and corrective direction.
- Report information and update managers throughout every shift with knowledge of that day’s production.
- Resolve employee issues through appropriate problem resolution. 
- Check and respond to emails in a timely manner.
- Balance quality, productivity, cost, safety and morale to achieve positive results in all areas. 
- Work to continuously improve processes. 
- Manage departmental performance measures, including visual controls and provides regular progress reports to Associate Production Manager/Manager during the shift.
- Submit paperwork at the end of the shift.
- Conduct daily shift meetings and safety meetings with employees.
- Conduct interviews for nonexempt shifts within the department.
- Perform accident investigations.  
- Manage department priorities as situations arise.
- Track absenteeism and timekeeping daily. 
- Perform accident investigations and notify management as appropriate

  **You are...**

- A leader: able to train and develop a large group of employees and manage multiple production lines
- A problem solver      
- Results driven 
- Able speak to employees with tact and diplomacy     
- Able to multitask: tracking/monitoring production and maintaining productivity
- Computer literate to input information into the computer
- Able to take direction and relay information to employees
- Comfortable with being exposed to cool and/or cold environment (10º - 40º)

**At a minimum, you have...**

- Required: High School Diploma or GED or related work experience 
- Preferred: At least 1-3 years of supervisory experience in a production environment 

**You’ll get…**

- Competitive Salary &  401K company match that vests immediately upon participation
- Generous parental leave of 16 weeks & PTO policy
- $0 monthly premium and other flexible health plans effective first day of employment
- 75% discount on your subscription to HelloFresh (as well as other product initiatives)
- Snacks, coffee & catered meals   
- Company sponsored outings & Employee Resource Groups
- Collaborative, dynamic work environment within a fast-paced, mission-driven company

 

It is the policy of HelloFresh not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Auditor (1st Shift)
jobs.description:
Quality Assurance Auditor  
This position will work at the receiving dock verifying all incoming ingredients against PO/Spec/ prior to the inventory team receiving the ingredient in our WMS system.   
Evaluating incoming ingredients (Produce/Dry goods) to ensure accuracy on specifications   
Inspecting proteins at dock prior to receiving them in our WMS system   
Assisting in the CCP verification of ingredient temperature at receiving  
Verification of allergen labeling and handling at dock  
Verification of operational practices to ensure compliance at receiving  
Directing movement of shipments to appropriate work areas once inspection has been finalized   
Assisting Food Safety Supervisor on numerous projects including (Temperature monitoring, Bundle Analysis, Sauce Testing, Protein inspections, Paper verification, Food Safety Daily Walkthroughs, etc)   
Promptly communicate all safety related issues and concerns  
Any and all other functions as determined by management

Must be able to stand on your feet and work between 8-12 hours per shift  
Must be able to grasp objects and lift up to 50lbs.  
Able to work in a cold kitchen area located in a walk-in refrigerator kept at 35 degrees

Working Conditions:  
Must be able to withstand temperatures ranging from -20 degrees Fahrenheit to 70 degrees Fahrenheit

You will have:

Previous warehouse receiving experience  
Attention to detail and quality control  
Able to work as part of a team and individually   
High School Diploma or equivalent

jobs.title: Quality Control Associate- 3 Month Contract
jobs.description:
**About HelloFresh...**

At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat. Over the past 7 years we have seen this mission spread around the world and beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are the leading global company in the expanding online recipe kit delivery market.

So, how did we do it? Our weekly recipe boxes full of exciting recipes and lovingly sourced, fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of encouraged, energized home cooks that expands across the globe. We are one of the fastest growing meal kit businesses and are active and growing in 10+ different countries across 3 continents. Our growth trajectory and expansion has been phenomenal, and we have launched facilities across Canada and have recently added Chef’s Plate to our team!

If you would like to join an energetic and highly motivated team and work in a dynamic, high-energy, high-growth field where you can really have an impact and make a difference every single day then join us and become part of developing a global fresh food champion.

As a Food Safety and Quality Assurance Technician at our BC locations, you will support the practice of maintaining the highest level of food safety and quality in our products and help define the direction of the industry. We are looking for a full-time QC Associate to join us at the Langley Distribution Centre.

**This is a 3 month full time opportunity with the possibility of extension**

**What you will be doing:**

- Be involved in quality control activities during in-bounding i.e. visual quality checks, weight checks and data entry
- Communicate with FSQA Team, Procurement and Production in case of product quality non-conformance
- Create tickets when escalations are required for quality non-conformance
- Maintain photo database of product non-conformance
- Complete offline sorting of small volumes and lead sorting if a Production team is needed to complete the activity
- Perform Production quality checks, such as online kit and case checks and portioning checks
- Responsible for compilation and maintenance of inspection reports and records (ex. GMP records, temp logs)
- Perform pre and post-operational sanitation reviews of the food processing environment and equipment, including swabbing

**Who you are:**

- 1 year experience in warehousing and/or food manufacturing
- Experience working in quality control is an asset
- Experience working in a GMP facility is an asset
- Flexible with working hours for business requirements, including early morning and late night shifts.
- Comfortable working in a deadline-driven and fast-paced environment
- Able to lift up to 15 kg
- Comfortable working in a cold environment and standing and walking for duration of shift
- Familiar with MS Office, Google Apps and comfortable learning new technology
- Comfortable learning and using new technology
- Team player who is comfortable collaborating with other departments but also working independently
- The above list of job duties is not exclusive or exhaustive and the candidate will be required to undertake such tasks as may reasonably be expected within the scope of the role.

**What you’ll get in return:**

- Competitive salary and company benefits
- High level of responsibility from day one
- The opportunity to rapidly advance your career
- Working with a fun, ambitious and supportive team

If this sounds like you, please click the "Apply Now" button. If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, but you'd like to know more about joining the HelloFresh team, please visit our Jobs page to view our other vacancies. We'd love to hear from you!

jobs.title: Quality Control Manager DACH (m/f/d)
jobs.description:
Wir bei HelloFresh sind hungrig nach mehr. Denn: “*We want to change the way people eat, forever”*. Mit unseren Kochboxen machen wir den Alltag unserer Kunden bereits in 12 Ländern auf 3 Kontinenten leichter. Und das jede Woche aufs Neue. Unser Erfolgsrezept? Ein Team voller smarter Team Player, unternehmerischer Mut und natürlich… guter Geschmack. Als einer der Top 10 Arbeitgeber im Glassdoor Ranking wachsen wir immer weiter. Und dazu braucht unser HelloFresh DACH Team Top-Talente wie Dich, die Fortschritt und gutes Essen genauso lieben wie wir. 

## **Deine Rolle**

#### Als Quality Control Manager bist Du als Verstärkung der Qualitätssicherung und -kontrolle am Produktionsstandort Verden tätig und trägst aktiv zur Weiterentwicklung unserer Lieferketten bei. Du stellst einen reibungslosen Freigabeprozess sowohl bei unseren Lieferanten als auch bei uns im Werk sicher. Dafür definierst Du in enger Abstimmung mit unseren Lieferanten Qualitätsstandards und Lieferbedingungen.

## **Dein Verantwortungsbereich**

- Intensive Überprüfung und aktive Freigabe der zu liefernden Produkte, sowohl beim Lieferanten, als auch der bereits zu uns gelieferten Produkte in unserem Wareneingang
- Sicherstellung der einheitlichen Umsetzung von Qualitätsvorgaben
- Reklamationsmanagement mit Schwerpunkt Qualitätsabweichungen und Abweichungen von einschlägigen Normen und Verordnungen
- Spezifizieren der angestrebten Qualitäten in Abstimmung mit unseren Zutaten-Spezialisten
- Spezifikationsmanagement in enger Zusammenarbeit mit den Lieferanten und unserem  Einkaufs- und Produktteam 
- Aktive Zusammenarbeit mit den Lieferanten zur Umsetzung von Maßnahmen zur Qualitätsverbesserung
- Koordination von Kommunikation und Ursachenanalyse bei kritischen Abweichungen beim Wareneingang
- Schulung der Wareneingangsmitarbeiter hinsichtlich Qualitätsparameter und Risiken der Produktkategorien
- Kommunikation von Lieferanforderungen und Abweichungen zu Lieferbedingungen, sowie Nachhalten von Vereinbarungen und Maßnahmen
- Erstellen von Änderungsvorschlägen zur Probenahme basierend auf der Lieferqualität
- Unterstützung bei der Durchführung von Produktanalysen nach dem vom Qualitätsmanagement-Team festgelegten Prüfplan

## **Dein Profil**

- Du verfügst über fundierte Fachkenntnisse und mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in der Warengruppe Obst und Gemüse und hast bereits Kenntnisse im Bereich Erzeugung gesammelt
- Die einschlägigen Normen und Verordnungen sind Dir bestens bekannt
- Du bist speziell geschult oder zertifiziert im Bereich Obst und Gemüse 
- Du verfügst über ein hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein und kennst Dich mit möglichen Mängeln an der Ware sehr gut aus
- Kommunikation und Verhandlungen sind Deine Stärken
- Du denkst schnell und pragmatisch, um schnelle Lösungen und passenden Ersatz zu finden
- Du zeigst keine Scheu vor risikobasierten Entscheidungen oder Ansätzen und bist in der schnellen Entscheidungsfindung geübt
- Eine ausgeprägte soziale Kompetenz und ein sicheres und freundliches Auftreten auch in Stresssituationen zeichnen Dich aus
- Selbst in herausfordernden Situationen bleibst Du ruhig und triffst fundierte Entscheidungen
- Die Fähigkeit zum Multitasking mit verschiedenen und konkurrierenden Arbeitsabläufen ist eine Stärke von Dir
- Du sprichst Deutsch auf muttersprachlichem Niveau und sehr gutes Englisch
- Du arbeitest selbstständig, strukturiert und gewissenhaft
- Du kannst Dich sehr gut organisieren und hast Deadlines stets im Blick
- Du überzeugst mit einem ausgeprägten Auge fürs Detail
- Du bist ein/e Macher/in mit Hands-On-Mentalität und Tatendrang
- Du bist bereit ab Tag 1 Verantwortung in einem dynamischen Arbeitsumfeld zu übernehmen
- Du bist kreativ und überzeugst mit Deiner Kommunikationsstärke/Sprachgefühl
- Du agierst auch in stressigen Situationen ruhig und bedacht
- Du überzeugst mit Entscheidungsstärke und Verantwortungsbewusstsein

## **Das bieten wir Dir außerdem **

- Die Möglichkeit, die neu entstehende Kochbox-Kategorie entscheidend mit zu definieren 
- Du lernst im direkten Austausch mit Experten und bist somit in der Lage, Dich stetig weiterzuentwickeln
- Eine attraktive und wettbewerbsfähige Vergütung und viel Raum für persönliches Wachstum
- Jährliches Budget für individuelle Weiterbildungen und Team Coachings
- Stark vergünstigte HelloFresh Kochbox und HelloFreshGO-Produkte sowie kostenloses Essen
- Windows oder Apple Ausstattung (je Präferenz)

## **Du bist auch hungrig nach mehr? **

Bewirb Dich jetzt mit Deinen vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen inkl. frühestmögliches Startdatum sowie Gehaltsvorstellungen.

Wir freuen uns auf Dich!

*HelloFresh lebt Vielfalt. jobs.descriptionHtml:
Wir bei HelloFresh sind hungrig nach mehr. Denn: “We want to change the way people eat, forever”. Mit unseren Kochboxen machen wir den Alltag unserer Kunden bereits in 12 Ländern auf 3 Kontinenten leichter. Und das jede Woche aufs Neue. Unser Erfolgsrezept? Ein Team voller smarter Team Player, unternehmerischer Mut und natürlich… guter Geschmack. Als einer der Top 10 Arbeitgeber im Glassdoor Ranking wachsen wir immer weiter. Und dazu braucht unser HelloFresh DACH Team Top-Talente wie Dich, die Fortschritt und gutes Essen genauso lieben wie wir.

Deine Rolle

Als Quality Control Manager bist Du als Verstärkung der Qualitätssicherung und -kontrolle am Produktionsstandort Verden tätig und trägst aktiv zur Weiterentwicklung unserer Lieferketten bei. Du stellst einen reibungslosen Freigabeprozess sowohl bei unseren Lieferanten als auch bei uns im Werk sicher. Dafür definierst Du in enger Abstimmung mit unseren Lieferanten Qualitätsstandards und Lieferbedingungen.

Dein Verantwortungsbereich

  • Intensive Überprüfung und aktive Freigabe der zu liefernden Produkte, sowohl beim Lieferanten, als auch der bereits zu uns gelieferten Produkte in unserem Wareneingang
  • Sicherstellung der einheitlichen Umsetzung von Qualitätsvorgaben
  • Reklamationsmanagement mit Schwerpunkt Qualitätsabweichungen und Abweichungen von einschlägigen Normen und Verordnungen
  • Spezifizieren der angestrebten Qualitäten in Abstimmung mit unseren Zutaten-Spezialisten
  • Spezifikationsmanagement in enger Zusammenarbeit mit den Lieferanten und unserem Einkaufs- und Produktteam
  • Aktive Zusammenarbeit mit den Lieferanten zur Umsetzung von Maßnahmen zur Qualitätsverbesserung
  • Koordination von Kommunikation und Ursachenanalyse bei kritischen Abweichungen beim Wareneingang
  • Schulung der Wareneingangsmitarbeiter hinsichtlich Qualitätsparameter und Risiken der Produktkategorien
  • Kommunikation von Lieferanforderungen und Abweichungen zu Lieferbedingungen, sowie Nachhalten von Vereinbarungen und Maßnahmen
  • Erstellen von Änderungsvorschlägen zur Probenahme basierend auf der Lieferqualität

  • Du denkst schnell und pragmatisch, um schnelle Lösungen und passenden Ersatz zu finden

jobs.title: Quality Manager
jobs.description:
***Come see what’s cookin’ at HelloFresh!***

At HelloFresh, we want to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch. We have offices all over the world and we deliver delicious meals to millions of people.  

We are the industry leader in meal-kit subscription services and we’re growing all the time. We have distinct meal-kit services that cater to everyone with the most menu variety in the market, which allows us to reach an incredibly wide population of people.

The HelloFresh team is diverse, high-performing, and international, and our work environment is an inspiring space where you can thrive as a result.

**As a Quality Manager you will... **

 

Have responsibility for all quality assurance related internal audits in adherence with regulatory standards. The position supervises a team of quality control inspectors. Additionally, the position develops, implements and manages quality control systems designed to ensure continuous production of advanced composite materials and applications (consistent with established standards, customer specifications and production goals). 

 

**Essential Functions**

*Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*

- Ensure a high level of internal and external customer service. Investigate (and correct) customer issues and complaints relating to quality.
- Manages the department engaged in inspection and testing activities to ensure high productivity and high technical integrity.
- Performing internal audits.
- Develop and analyze statistical data and product specifications to determine standards and to establish quality and reliability expectancy of finished products.
- Coordinate objectives with production procedures in cooperation with other plant managers to maximize product reliability and minimize costs.
- Create, document and implement inspection criteria and procedures.
- Interpret quality control philosophy to key personnel within company.
- Maintain an active role on internal continuous improvement teams.
- Design, develop and implement quality control training programs.
- Provide, and oversee, inspection activity for products throughout the production cycle.
- Interact with vendors and procurement to ensure quality of all purchased parts.
- Addressing nonconformities from previous internal and external audits.
- Conducting a management review of the quality system.
- Following-up on and closing pending preventive and corrective action requests.
- Ensuring that organizational systems and training is in place.
- Ensuring that documentation and design controls are appropriate for organization.
- Administering document control and configuration management system.
- Overseeing established calibration and testing programs.
- Assisting the management team and providing QA support as necessary.
- Provide all employees with necessary tools, proper training and corrective direction.
- Report food safety and quality problems to personnel with authority to initiate action

 

**You are/have...**

- Leadership: train and develop a large group of employees       
- Performance Management: for assigned production lines
- Problem Solving/Analysis    
- Results Driven
- Communication Proficiency: speak to employees with tact and diplomacy     
- Time Management: tracking/monitoring production and maintaining productivity
- Technical Capacity: computer literacy to input information into the computer
- Learning Orientation: able to take direction and relay information to employees

 

**Supervisory Responsibility**

**This position manages all employees of the department and is responsible for the performance management and hiring of the employees within that department.**

 

**Work Environment**

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is in a manufacturing and assembly environment and is regularly exposed to cool and/or cold temperatures (10º - 40º). The employee is frequently exposed to fumes or airborne particles, moving mechanical parts and vibration. The noise level in the work environment and job sites can be loud. 

 

**Physical Demands**

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, stoop, reach and lift for a minimum of 10 to 12 hours with or without reasonable accommodation. The employee is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects and/or tools. The employee is required to talk or hear with or without reasonable accommodation. 

 

The employee must regularly lift and move up to 25 pounds, and occasionally lift and move up to 50 pounds with or without assistance. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and peripheral vision.

 

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**

This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are varied according to shift and production schedule. The employee is expected to work no less than the designated 40 hour work week. Significant weekend work depending on production schedules.

 

**Travel**

Travel​ is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected.

**At a minimum, you have...**

- Associate’s degree or related management work experience.
- At least 5 years of work experience in quality assurance, should be combined with a demonstrated track-record of accomplishments as a quality assurance manager, and with satisfying customers in technology-driven, developing companies.

 

**Other Duties**

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be supplemented at any time with or without notice.

 

**You’ll Get...**

- Competitive Salary & 401k company match that vests immediately upon participation
- Generous parental leave of 16 weeks & PTO policy, as well as paid holidays off
- $0 monthly premium and other flexible health plans
- Amazing discounts, including up to 75% off HelloFresh subscription
- Flexible shift scheduling & advancement opportunities
- Emergency child and adult care services
- Snacks & monthly catered lunches
- Collaborative, dynamic work environment within a fast-paced, mission-driven company

It is the policy of HelloFresh not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran

jobs.title: Quality Supervisor
jobs.description:
***Come see what’s cookin’ at HelloFresh!***

At HelloFresh, we want to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch. We have offices all over the world and we deliver delicious meals to millions of people.  

We are the industry leader in meal-kit subscription services and we’re growing all the time. We have distinct meal-kit services that cater to everyone with the most menu variety in the market, which allows us to reach an incredibly wide population of people.

The HelloFresh team is diverse, high-performing, and international, and our work environment is an inspiring space where you can thrive as a result.

**Hello Quality...HelloFRESH**

As Quality Supervisor, you will have a direct hand in ensuring ingredients of the highest quality are dished out to our customers’ dinner tables! You will go out in front and lead from the trenches of the shop floor to drive food safety quality standards.

***You will…***

- Support the Quality Manager and supervise team leads and associates involved in inspection and quality control procedures with regards to purchased material, in-process material and finished products to assure that quality control standards are achieved
- Lead workforce planning and scheduling
- Develop and maintain inspection equipment to meet quality control standards, make suggestions with regards to procedures, standards and equipment to facilitate work and maintain product quality
- Support the company's food safety and SQF compliance initiatives including the execution of related daily tasks
- Analyze facts or circumstances surrounding individual problems to determine what action should be taken within the limits of standard practices
- Investigate and determine the cause of faulty work and consult and advise other departments as to corrective measures
- Work closely with Purchasing to ensure adequate quantities and ingredient quality meets expectations
- Maintain discipline, morale and harmonious relations among subordinates
- Effectively recommend as to hiring, promotions, wage adjustments and terminations
- Create a positive team dynamic that encourages all employees in the Facility to provide feedback and drive change from within, adapt to the ever-changing business, and stay focused on the customer experience

***You are...***

- Foodie: you have a strong appreciation for flavor, a knack for sourcing fresh ingredients, and a keen eye for quality
- Bold: you are a true entrepreneurial spirit and not afraid to take calculated risks to disrupt the status quo; you have vision, but also encourage feedback from employees in the trenches and host frequent brainstorming sessions with the team
- Analytical: numbers and data are your friend; you're able to translate numbers into action and pave the way for efficiency
- Agile: you thrive in autonomous environments with high growth and don't get overwhelmed easily
- Results-driven: you're a natural problem solver with excellent prioritization skills and a focus on quality
- Customer-focused: you understand the importance of highly satisfied customers and are committed to delivering a product and experience that is second to none

***You have...***

- High school diploma or GED required; college degree preferred
- 1+ years’ supervisory experience in manufacturing or fulfillment
- 3+ years QA/QC experience in food production/processing plant
- Versed in food safety procedures and regulations (HACCP, SQF, GMPs, etc.)
- Bilingual English - Spanish preferred 
- Efficient Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Power Point) and Google app (Gmail, drive, sheets, etc.) capabilities
- Intermediate computer skills requirement – data analysis/creation, Microsoft Office (esp. Excel) and/or Google Sheets equivalent
- Demonstrated success with driving and delivering results against established company criteria and key performance indicators
- Ability to work nights, weekends, and holidays **(schedule will include weekends)**

***You'll get...***

- Competitive Salary & 401k company match that vests immediately upon participation  
 • Generous parental leave of 16 weeks & PTO policy, as well as paid holidays off   
 • $0 monthly premium and other flexible health plans   
 • Amazing discounts, including up to 75% off HelloFresh subscription  
 • Flexible shift scheduling & advancement opportunities   
 • Emergency child and adult care services   
 • Snacks & monthly catered lunches   
 • Collaborative, dynamic work environment within a fast-paced, mission-driven company

*It is the policy of HelloFresh not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.*

jobs.title: Receiving Specialist
jobs.description:
**The Opportunity**

We're building a fulfillment center from the ground up, and we're looking for passionate team members to help us create an incredible customer experience and an amazing place to work! We are seeking an individual who thrives in a challenging, evolving work environment as our operations continue to grow. You will report to the Receiving Manager and will be responsible for receiving food items, identifying and resolving quality issues while working side by side with the Food Safety and Regulatory Compliance Team.

**You will…**

- Assist in receiving all food and non-food items daily
- Identify quality issues with incoming product and work collaboratively with the teams to ensure that only the best products are accepted into our facility
- Maintain a clean and organized work environment including food storage and non-food storage areas
- Work closely with the Food Safety and Regulatory Compliance team to ensure all products meet food safety standards
- Work closely with the Production Management team to ensure all issues are communicated effectively to reduce deviations in production schedule
- Loading and unloading allinbound and outbound shipments

#### Requirements

- High School Diploma, post-secondary education preferred
- 1-2 year experience in a high volume receiving role or high volume food service environment
- Experience working with produce is a benefit
- Experience working in a warehouse environment/shipping and receiving
- The ability to operate motorized hand trucks
- Forklift, Reach Truck or Stacker Operator license is ideal, but we will train the right candidates
- Clear and concise communicator, verbal and written
- Ability to work calmly and effectively under pressure
- Ability to work in fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment
- Overtime, weekend, evening and holiday work, as required
- Must be willing and able to lift up to 49 pounds with or without reasonable accommodation
- Must be willing and able to handle exposure to temperatures that range from freezing to sub-freezing (coolers, freezers, etc.) with or without accommodation
- Must be willing and able to stand/walk for up to 8 hours with or without reasonable accommodation

#### Benefits

**Why join the  team?**

We’re building the leading online food brand in Canada. If you’re looking to get involved in the early stages of a fast-growing company, then this role is for you!

**Perks include:**

- Opportunity for increased responsibility and growth within the company
- 75% Employee discounts on all Hello Fresh weekly meal kits
- Opportunity to work with a highly engaged team
- A company culture that promotes out of the box thinking

jobs.title: Safety Coordinator
jobs.description:
**Safety Coordinator**

** **

***Come see what’s cookin’ at Green Chef/HelloFresh!***

Since the digitization of the grocery and meal delivery industry, HelloFresh has been at the forefront of revolutionizing the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to whip up mouthwatering meals from home! With over 500% growth since our inception in 2011, we’re now the fastest growing company in Europe and the biggest European startup in the US - active and growing in 9 different countries across 3 continents. Come see what’s cookin’ at HelloFresh!

**Safety Coordinator**

Due to growth, HelloFresh is looking to add a Safety Coordinator to join our team! As Safety Coordinator, you will join forces with the site EHS team to head up workplace safety initiatives for our distribution centers! You will be on the front lines of production and immerse yourself in the trenches to promote Green Chef/HelloFresh’s vision, inspire change, raise the bar on safety performance, and champion a culture of safety!

**You will…**

- Assisting EHS site teams as a visual presence on the production floor and identify safety risks
- Assist in implementing and sustaining EHS policies
- Assist EHS site teams with accident root cause procedures and reporting
- Assisting EHS site teams as a visual presence on the production floor
- Identify safety risks present on the floor to be fixed or addressed
- Complete EHS related audits and after-action responses to the identified gaps
- Coordinator other associates on the floor with ergonomics, safety, and other related issues
- Identify employees violating safety rules and coordinator them on a safer way
- Act as an on-site first responder who can provide basic first aid to injured persons
- Ensure contractors and visitors follow HelloFresh safety policies during their time on-site
- Assist with the site emergency action plan and liaison with local first responders when needed
- Promotes good housekeeping practices and maintains 5S floor organization
- Promote safer forklift operations through training, observation and coordinating operators

**You are…**

- Partner: you effectively listen, build rapport and communicate at all levels; you’re confident sharing ideas and are a trusted advisor for workplace safety
- Results-driven: you recognize and resolve situations that are ambiguous or challenging, focus effort on meeting or exceeding goals, and pave the way for efficiency.
- Programmatic: able to identify the system component that is causing the error, as well as the options available for resolving it and completing the task.
- Inspirational: you know how to make an impact and deliver presentations that inspire and influence change
- Versatile: you roll with the punches and don’t get overwhelmed easily; you enjoy grinding away at issues and have a knack for driving results in hyper-growth, constantly changing environments

**You have…**

- A desire to achieve greatness and assist a world class EHS teamwork toward our zero-injury goal!
- General Knowledge of occupational safety experience with knowledge of manufacturing/industrial EHS
- High school diploma or GED equivalent
- Experience helping to improve safety culture
- Superior communication and presentation skills with the ability to influence across all levels of an organization
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and Google app (Gmail, drive, sheets, etc.)

**Outstanding candidates will have….**

- Expertise in OSHA compliance, especially with powered industrial trucks and lockout/tagout
- OSHA 30 Hour Certification - General Industry

It is the policy of HelloFresh not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.

jobs.title: Sales Operations Analyst Intern (Spring/Summer)
jobs.description:
***Come see what’s cookin’ at HelloFresh!***

 

At HelloFresh, we want to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch. We have offices all over the world and we deliver delicious meals to millions of people.  

We are the industry leader in meal-kit subscription services and we’re growing all the time. We have distinct meal-kit services that cater to everyone with the most menu variety in the market, which allows us to reach an incredibly wide population of people.

The HelloFresh team is diverse, high-performing, and international, and our work environment is an inspiring space where you can thrive as a result.

**Sales Operations Analyst Intern Job Description:**

The US Sales division is a rapidly growing start-up within a start-up. Our department started two years ago, and we are already becoming the number one channel for growth and new customer acquisition. Our Sales Operations team provides administrative support, data reporting, operational structure, and strategic guidance for 19+ sales offices based in local markets around the country.  The Sales Operations Analyst Intern will play a critical role in supporting this team and our rapid growth. Candidates will need to be available for the Spring and Summer 2020.

 0-5% travel required  

**You will ...**

- Analyze and be comfortable with all data in the sales division including but not limited to sales, expenses, recruitment, human resource, revenue (cancellations, average order value, customer retention)
- Maintain, troubleshoot, and improve current data visualization dashboards on Tableau and Google Sheets that support data-driven decision-making for executive leaders, local and regional sales managers, territory coordinators, and recruiters
- Identify and implement improved data collection and sources, including but not limited to self-reported data from Google Forms, SQL queries from our international data warehouse, local spending data, etc.
- Conduct ad-hoc analyses to identify potential operational inefficiencies and/or test new products, services, or offers
- Use data to identify and execute operational strategies to improve sales division efficiency and effectiveness
- Design, build and maintain processes needed to improve sales team performance
- Provide support and guidance as needed to local and regional sales managers
- Partner cross-functionally with other HelloFresh teams including but not limited to Recruiting, HR, Finance, Legal, and Tech

**You are...**

- A critical thinker—who uses logic to identify alternatives, evaluate, and present approaches to solve complex problems
- An excellent communicator of complex (often technical) information to various audiences
- Enterprising to take up and start new projects. Able to achieve work with risk of failure
- Detail-oriented—careful and thorough in accomplishing tasks
- Enjoys coming up with solutions to increase efficiency in their day to day work
- Driven to make a big impact on the sales organization and the wider business

**At a minimum, you have...**

- Have or are pursuing a BS degree in Business Administration, Economics Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or a related field (undergraduate and graduate students will also be considered)
- 0-2 years of experience delivering quantitative insights
- Experience delivering actionable, data-driven insights
- Strong MS Excel / Google sheets ability
- Experience using SQL based databases
- Preferred: Tableau/Python knowledge or an ability to learn

*It is the policy of HelloFresh not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because they are a protected veteran.** *

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer (Golang)(m/f/x)
jobs.description:
At HelloFresh, our mission is to change the way people eat - forever. From our 2011 founding in Europe’s vibrant tech hub Berlin, we’ve become the global market leader in the meal kit sector and inspire millions of energised home cooks across the globe every week.

We offer our meal kit boxes full of exciting recipes and thoughtfully sourced, fresh ingredients in more than 12 countries, operating from offices in Berlin, New York City, Sydney, Toronto, London, Amsterdam and Copenhagen and shipped out more than 250 Million meals in 2019. 

Our more than 5,000 employees are the heart and soul of our highly international, fast-paced, and dynamic environment where innovation and smart, fast action is encouraged.

We want you to join us and help take HelloFresh to the next level - as a company in its growth phase this is a great time to join. Career and development opportunities are endless. 

We will encourage you to make an immediate impact in your area of work as well as empower you to grow your career with us.

Our Engineering, Data, Product and Security teams are located in Berlin and New York and are critical to what we do. From procurement tools, to conversion rate optimization, live pricing tools, payment services and add-on upselling features, we work on challenging problems and have a high output of building and releasing features and engines that make our business thrive and deliver real financial impact.

You can get a taste of what we've been working on by checking out our [tech blog](https://engineering.hellofresh.com/).

## **About the job**

- Our Backend Engineers assume development and operational responsibility for the HelloFresh platform that serves millions globally to deliver the best experience for our customers and internal users 
- They take ownership of the architecture, design, development, deployment and operations of the microservices they develop, using DevOps practices, pair programming and other cutting edge methodologies 
- They are active, solution-oriented members of autonomous, cross-functional agile teams collaborating with Product Owners, Front-end Engineers, Designers, and Business Intelligence teams 
- They participate in bi-weekly [Chapter Days](https://engineering.hellofresh.com/paying-technical-debt-and-driving-excellence-with-chapter-days-88c4304a0948?source=collection_home---4------1-----------------------) to take part in exploratory initiatives and to share knowledge and trends with the engineering department 
- They have an in-depth understanding of HelloFresh’s core product and architecture, and act as ambassador for software solutions offering support and mentorship to colleagues
- They are comfortable with state-of-the-art technologies like Kafka, RabbitMQ, Spark, Kubernetes, Istio, and more

**Who we are looking for**

- You have solid back-end experience within Microservice architecture using Golang, PHP and/or Python 
- You have experience working with Docker and container orchestration technologies such as Kubernetes
- You are experienced in CI/CD methods and practices
- You have practical experience of TDD, BDD, DDD and distributed architectural patterns
- You have a background working with event-driven architectures using RabbitMQ and/or Kafka
- You are experienced in end-to-end development processes, including unit, integration & functional testing, distributed architecture, application tuning/profiling, and continuous integration
- You have experience working with relational and document databases, including PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB
- You thrive in the opportunity to collaborate and mentor team members, while also sharing practical knowledge and trends

Interacting with front-end developers, designers, product managers and our teams around the world is very much part of our day-to-day, so communication skills are vital. We are looking for strong problem-solvers who can apply their engineering skills to a wide range of platforms and environments, while also acting as an ambassador to coach team members and stakeholders.

## **What we offer**

- Relocation assistance to move to Berlin and visa application support
- Competitive compensation
- Significant reduction on our meal kits
- Annual learning and development budget to attend conferences or purchase educational resources
- Sabbatical policy
- Work in our office located in the heart of Berlin
- A diverse and vibrant international environment
- A range of perks (Free in-house crash course in German, compensation for advanced German classes, in-house lecture series and knowledge sharing programme, discounts for our neighboring gym & Urban Sports Club, free weekly yoga classes, summer & winter parties, discount on our HelloFresh GO vending machines)
- The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase

## **Are you up for a challenge?**

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

- Advanced engineering abilities to deliver flexible and scalable end-to-end machine learning solutions.
- Great coding skills in Python and knowledge of data libraries such as sklearn, NLTK, and pandas. Knowledge of Deep Learning frameworks like Tensorflow or Keras is a plus.

- A self-organized individual, with excellent focus and prioritization of workload using business data and metrics.

- Work in a cross-functional team with a product owner, engineers, designers and analysts
- Help to enable your product team to iterate fast and learn about our customer by planning, building, testing and launching features and A/B experiments
- Collaborate with engineers across your department and the company to continuously improve our code base, systems and processes
- Design and develop efficient solutions that can continue to scale
- Coach and mentor other team members through workshops, pair programming, and code reviews 
- Contribute to recruiting by attracting, reviewing and interviewing candidates

- You have a knack for anything that happens on the web
- You speak HTML, CSS and JavaScript perfectly
- You keep up to date with the latest developments in web technologies

- You can handle pixel perfect UX designers very well
- You have ambition to develop yourself and learn from your peers
- You know how to take responsibility
- You can work in fast-paced teams
- You are passionate about mentoring and sharing knowledge.

- A diverse and vibrant international environment

- The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phas

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.description:
** ***** Come see what’s cookin’ at HelloFresh!***

At HelloFresh, we want to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch. We have offices all over the world and we deliver delicious meals to millions of people. 

We are the industry leader in meal-kit subscription services and we’re growing all the time. We have distinct meal-kit services that cater to everyone with the most menu variety in the market, which allows us to reach an incredibly wide population of people.

The HelloFresh team is diverse, high-performing, and international, and our work environment is an inspiring space where you can thrive as a result.

**Job Description:**

We are a close-knit group of engineers of different stripes - developers, testers, and product owners - who are working together to solve interesting e-commerce and supply chain problems around how people eat. Sometimes, this involves executing experiments to improve the user journey and making it easier for our customers to buy amazing food. Sometimes, this means creating stable software solutions that keep our distribution centers running.

We are looking for a **Senior Full Stack Engineer** who is excited by great code that scales well. As a member of our NYC team, you’ll work with highly-skilled engineers who have been solving problems in this space for quite some time, and have turned HelloFresh into the #1 meal delivery service in the world!

Here at HelloFresh, the learning never stops. We expect you to learn every day, both through your work and beyond. We tend to set ambitious learning OKRs for each employee, and then support you through dedicated self-development time and learning budget.

If you value speed and agility and believe in a data-driven development space, this is the place for you. The ideal candidate for this role will leverage data - test results, logs, defect rates - to ruthlessly prioritize the work that needs to be done and collaborate with both local and international teams to find MVP solutions.

#### **You will ...**

- Be able to design-develop-deploy software solutions in the HelloFresh platform that serves millions globally to deliver the best experience for our customers and internal users
- Take ownership of the architecture, design, development, deployment, and operations of the microservices that you develop, using DevOps practices, pair programming, and other cutting edge methodologies
- Be able to spend time learning and developing technical skills in dedicated learning sessions, and show off your technical chops via ambitious OKRs

**You are...**

- An active, solution-oriented member of autonomous, cross-functional agile teams collaborating with Product Owners, Frontend and Backend Engineers, Designers, and Business Intelligence teams
- Able to develop an in-depth understanding of HelloFresh’s core product and architecture, and act as an ambassador for state of the art software solutions and industry best practices offering support and mentorship to colleagues

#### **At a minimum, you have...**

- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or, equivalent
- 4+ years of working experience in an agile software development team
- Proficient in 1 of the following technologies (2+ years), and working knowledge of 3 of the following technologies (1+ years):
  - Frontend: React JS, Angular JS, React Native
  - Backend: Golang, Python, NodeJS
- Hands-on experience in continuous delivery in the cloud using Docker, Kubernetes, Lambda functions, Terraform, and/or AWS CLI
- Experience with writing unit/integration/function test cases, as well as with formalized testing methodologies (i.e. TDD, BDD, DDD)
- Exposure to both relational databases (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL technologies (e.g. MongoDB), with demonstrable ability to write and execute effective queries

**You’ll get…**

- Competitive Salary & 401k company match that vests immediately upon participation
- Generous parental leave of 16 weeks & PTO policy
- $0 monthly premium and other flexible health plans effective first day of employment
- 75% discount on your subscription to HelloFresh (as well as other product initiatives)
- Snacks, cold brew on tap & monthly catered lunches
- Company-sponsored outings & Employee Resource Groups
- Collaborative, dynamic work environment within a fast-paced, mission-driven company

 

It is the policy of HelloFresh not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.

jobs.title: Senior Legal Counsel (m/w/x)
jobs.description:
Bei HelloFresh ist es unser Ziel, die Art wie Menschen essen für immer zu verändern. Mit unseren hochwertigen Kochboxen liefern wir unseren Kunden die Chance, sich einfach und bequem jeden Tag gesund, lecker und genussvoll zu ernähren. Unser Wachstum sowie unsere Expansion sind einzigartig – HelloFresh zählt zu den erfolgreichsten europäischen Start-ups. Wir sind bereits in zwölf Ländern auf drei Kontinenten aktiv, befinden uns weiterhin auf Wachstumskurs und sind seit über zwei Jahren an der Frankfurter Wertpapierbörse gelistet.

Wenn Du mindestens drei Jahre Berufserfahrung in einer renommierten Anwaltskanzlei gesammelt und dabei im Gesellschaftsrecht, im Handelsrecht, im allgemeinen Zivil- oder Vertragsrecht gearbeitet hast und über ausgezeichnete Englischkenntnisse verfügst, dann sollten wir uns kennen lernen. 

## **Deine Aufgaben**

- Du wirst in unserer Rechtsabteilung arbeiten und direkt an einen der Abteilungsleiter der Rechtsabteilung berichten
- Du wirst für eine Vielzahl von Rechtsfragen verantwortlich sein (z.B. allgemeines Zivil- und Vertragsrecht, Gesellschaftsrecht, Handelsrecht) und wirst unseren Managern bis hin zum internationalen Topmanagement beratend zur Seite stehen
- Du wirst verschiedene Verträge erstellen oder überarbeiten und Dich in diesem Zusammenhang unmittelbar mit den Managern unseres Unternehmens austauschen
- Du wirst unterschiedliche Projekte mit externen Rechtsberatern von HelloFresh betreuen
- Du wirst in einem sehr internationalen, hochdynamischen und unternehmerischen Umfeld arbeiten

## **Das solltest Du mitbringen**

- Du hast Deine beiden juristischen Staatsexamina mit weit überdurchschnittlichem Erfolg (mindestens mit der Note “Vollbefriedigend”) abgeschlossen
- Du kannst mindestens drei Jahre Berufserfahrung in einer renommierten Anwaltskanzlei vorweisen
- Du verfügst über ausgezeichnete deutsche und englische Sprachkenntnisse
- Du hast insgesamt ein gutes Rechtsverständnis
- Du traust Dir zu, eigenständig zu arbeiten, Entscheidungen zu treffen und diese auch intern und extern zu vertreten
- Du zeigst außerordentliche Leistungsbereitschaft

## **Was wir Dir bieten**

- Eine sehr anspruchsvolle Position in einem der erfolgreichsten europäischen Start-ups
- Aktive Beteiligung an vielen wichtigen Projekten von HelloFresh
- Wettbewerbsfähige Vergütung und viel Platz für die persönliche Entwicklung
- Große internationale Präsenz und eine offene und sehr angenehme Atmosphäre im Team
- Die Möglichkeit, eine stark wachsende Organisation bedeutend und nachhaltig zu beeinflussen
- Ein Budget für eigene Trainings- und Entwicklungsinitiativen
- Kochst Du gerne? Du erhältst signifikanten Rabatt auf jede HelloFresh-Box, die Du bestellst
- Wöchentlichen Discount an den HelloFreshGO-Kühlschränken, die täglich frisch zubereitete Wraps, Salate, Mahlzeiten und Snacks bereithalten
- Kostenlose Getränke und frisches Obst den ganzen Tag
- Friday Beers
- Regelmäßige Teamausflüge
- Altersvorsorgeprogramm und Sabbatical Policy
- Rabatte für unser benachbartes Fitnessstudio & Urban Sports Club sowie kostenloses Office Yoga und weitere Rabatte bei zahlreichen Partnerunternehmen
- Wähle Deine Hardware: Apple oder Windows

## **Bist Du interessiert?**

Sende uns jetzt unten Deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen zu. Lass uns außerdem Dein frühestmögliches Startdatum sowie Deine Gehaltsvorstellungen wissen.

jobs.title: Senior Manager Global Consumer PR (m/f/x)
jobs.description:
At HelloFresh, our mission is to change the way people eat - forever. From our 2011 founding in Europe’s vibrant tech hub Berlin, we’ve become the global market leader in the meal kit sector and inspire millions of energised home cooks across the globe every week.

We offer our meal kit boxes full of exciting recipes and thoughtfully sourced, fresh ingredients in more than 12 countries, operating from offices in Berlin, New York City, Sydney, Toronto, London, Amsterdam and Copenhagen and shipped out more than 250 Million meals in 2019. 

Our more than 5,000 employees are the heart and soul of our highly international, fast-paced, and dynamic environment where innovation and smart, fast action is encouraged. We want you to join us and help take HelloFresh to the next level - as a company in its growth phase this is a great time to join. Career and development opportunities are endless. We will encourage you to make an immediate impact in your area of work as well as empower you to grow your career with us.

## **About the job**

- As member of the Global Brand Marketing Team, translate the Global HelloFresh brand strategy into engaging PR activities and compelling stories
- Drive local market consumer PR together with local market PR Managers
- Drive global messaging, including  sustainability communication, and support local teams in planning and successful campaign execution
- Develop quarterly global PR plan
- Create quarterly qualitative market reports, incl. analysis of strength and weakness per market
- Ensure frequent high level results, reaching key target audiences
- Work closely with global marketing and communication teams to align and  ensure integrated communication messaging
- Support local managing directors and marketing teams with market expansion and brand positioning analysis, develop product launch PR strategies
- Manage global alignment and strengthen regular exchange between all markets to support knowledge transfer and increase project efficiency
- Lead Junior Manager Consumer PR in the team

## **Who we are looking for**

- BS/MS from a top tier university in Marketing, Communications, or another related field of study
- 5+ years experience in a PR-manager role, ideally in the areas of food, tech or culture
- High affinity for consumer lifestyle topics and trends, especially in the field of nutrition, health, eCommerce
- Strong out-of-the-box thinking with the ability to translate strategy into creative ideas
- Proven track-record of leading cross-country teams, motivating and inspiring them with a positive attitude
- Hands-on experience project managing an initiative from start to finish. Achieves project goals while managing scope, time, quality and risk. Learns from failures as well as successes.
- Constantly challenging status quo and seeking for further improvement
- Excellent skills in English, second language is a plus (German, French and Dutch)
- Strong analytical capabilities and able to understand and develop strategy

## **What we offer**

- Work for a love-brand
- Be at the fore-front of creative development
- Work with top players in the market
- The chance to have a serious impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase
- A vibrant, international environment
- A guaranteed steep learning curve
- Competitive compensation incl. participation in HelloFresh’s VSOP and RSU program 2018
- Sabbatical policy
- Benefit from our selection of employee perks (significant reduction on your HelloFresh boxes, discount on the HelloFresh GO vending machines, free German classes, Geek Friday, discounts for our neighboring Fitness Studio & Urban Sports Club, annual budget for training and development initiatives, weekly Yoga Classes, Summer & Winter Party)

## **Are you up for a challenge?**

Please submit your complete application below including your earliest starting date.

jobs.title: Senior Manager, IT
jobs.description:
***Come see what’s cookin’ at HelloFresh!***

 

At HelloFresh, we want to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch. We have offices all over the world and we deliver delicious meals to millions of people.  

We are the industry leader in meal-kit subscription services and we’re growing all the time. We have distinct meal-kit services that cater to everyone with the most menu variety in the market, which allows us to reach an incredibly wide population of people.

The HelloFresh team is diverse, high-performing, and international, and our work environment is an inspiring space where you can thrive as a result.

**Job Description: **

We are looking for a Senior IT Manager who will be in charge of helping plan, execute, and maintain all IT components in  HelloFresh facilities (corporate offices and customer care centers). In addition, the Senior IT manager will coordinate efforts with IT team members at other locations and acquired companies.   This is a newly created role due to growth. This  individual will have the opportunity to shape the technology department in our NYC corporate office. He/She will pursue a unified, streamlined environment across all HelloFresh US operations aligned with Global IT. 

#### **You will ...**

- Management: Manage a staff of IT Associates that sit on location at other sites.
- Asset management: Establish and manage the process to procure and maintain hardware inventory, manage licensing agreements, making sure both are optimized and in full compliance
- Provisioning: serve as a point of contact for all onboarding / offboarding procedures for employees in the office you reside in. Maintaining lean user and permission base throughout different services (3rd party and internal tools)
- IT vendors management: assessment and inception of technical contracts, while maintaining budget framework. making sure that vendors are in accordance with SLAs at all times
- Support the day-to-day operation: manage all aspects of systems maintenance including: software upgrades, database maintenance, end user support, troubleshooting, auditing systems and problem-solving
- Information Security: establish & Enforce IT policies & best practices, run periodical check-ups and train employees on data protection practices
- Special Projects: manage IT projects from initiation to completion (incl’ budget, timeline, resources, and reporting)
- Be responsible for on going evaluation and improvement of existing Service Desk processes and policies
- Participate in occasional off-hours and weekend support of system upgrades and initiatives

**You are...**

- Well-rounded hands-on IT infrastructure leader preferably in a multi-site high availability environment. 
- Proven record of success in building, growing and mentoring staff supporting IT
- Excellent problem-solving skills 
- Thrive working in a fast pace environment 

#### **At a minimum, you have...**

- Minimum of 5 years in a corporate technology environment required
- Minimum of 3 year managing direct reports required
- Experience supporting of IP networking technologies (TCP, Routing, Firewalls)
- Experience with Enterprise IT tools (GSuite, Atlassian, Slack, BetterCloud and others)
- Experience supporting Windows Server products is a required
- Experience of corporate WiFi environment (Controllers, APs, etc) 
- Experience and experience with Windows 7, 8, 10; Microsoft Office; Mac OS
- Strong troubleshooting abilities and excellent organizational, time management, and service delivery skills required
- IT-related certifications are desirable
- Willingness to travel on an occasional basis required

**You’ll get…**

- Competitive Salary & 401k company match that vests immediately upon participation
- Generous parental leave of 16 weeks & PTO policy
- $0 monthly premium and other flexible health plans effective first day of employment
- 75% discount on your subscription to HelloFresh (as well as other product initiatives)   
- Snacks, cold brew on tap & monthly catered lunches
- Company sponsored outings & Employee Resource Groups
- Collaborative, dynamic work environment within a fast-paced, mission-driven company  

 

It is the policy of HelloFresh not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.
